channel.title: Industry Today
channel.description: Industry Today is a unique radio talk show format that features diversified news, segments involving companies and trends taking place in the industrial market, plus related business, economic and financial programs. The Industry Today show podcasts are produced exclusively by industrialinfo.com (Industrial Info Resources). To listen to all of our broadcasts, visit the ITunes Store and search for industrialinfo.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Exclusively from Industrialinfo.com, Industry Today podcasts feature the latest in industrial market news, companies within industry, market trends, business, economic and finance.
channel.itunes:summary: Industry Today is a unique radio talk show format that features diversified news, segments involving companies and trends taking place in the industrial market, plus related business, economic and financial programs. The Industry Today show podcasts are produced exclusively by industrialinfo.com (Industrial Info Resources). To listen to our live broadcast, visit the ITunes Radio library and find industrialinfo under the genre Talk/Spoken Word or 50s/60s Pop.
channel.itunes:author: Industrial Info Resources, Inc.
channel.itunes:keywords: iir, industrial, industrialinfo, industrial info, industrial info resources, oldies, industry, news, marketing, analysis

The Industry Today show podcasts are produced exclusively by industrialinfo.com (Industrial Info Resources). To listen to our live broadcast, visit the ITunes Radio library and find industrialinfo under the genre Business News.

item.title: Efficient and Reliable LED Lighting Technology, by Dialight
item.description: Dialight (Farmingdale, New Jersey) defines the current state of LED lighting technology with continuous innovations in light output, efficiency and reliability by offering a complete line of high-specification lighting fixtures specifically designed for industrial, commercial, hazardous location, transportation & public infrastructure applications. Dialight maintains a commitment to advancing solid-state lighting products that vastly reduce maintenance, improve safety, ease disposal, and are more environmentally friendly - thereby helping to reduce CO2 emissions, the dominant GHG contributor to global warming. Join Roy Burton, CEO of Dialight along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their high-specification range of products that are uniquely positioned for a number of long-term global growth trends, many of which are driven by government regulations and environmental initiatives.
item.itunes:subtitle: Efficient and Reliable LED Lighting Technology, by Dialight
item.itunes:summary: Dialight (Farmingdale, New Jersey) defines the current state of LED lighting technology with continuous innovations in light output, efficiency and reliability by offering a complete line of high-specification lighting fixtures specifically designed for industrial, commercial, hazardous location, transportation & public infrastructure applications. Dialight maintains a commitment to advancing solid-state lighting products that vastly reduce maintenance, improve safety, ease disposal, and are more environmentally friendly - thereby helping to reduce CO2 emissions, the dominant GHG contributor to global warming. Join Roy Burton, CEO of Dialight along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their high-specification range of products that are uniquely positioned for a number of long-term global growth trends, many of which are driven by government regulations and environmental initiatives.

item.title: A World-class Range of Blowers for Low Pressure Applications, by HIBON
item.description: With experience dating back more than a century, HIBON offers the market a world-class range of blowers used to provide air/gas at a variety of volumes and pressures to meet a variety of industrial applications. ISO 9001 certified for the design, manufacture and maintenance of blowers. HIBON is dedicated to quality, through the quality of its people and performance of its product. Join Dean Alcott, Industrial Sales Manager, US for HIBON along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about HIBON's emphasis on continuous innovation and development.
item.itunes:subtitle: A World-class Range of Blowers for Low Pressure Applications, by HIBON

item.title: The Wall Street Journal - An Inside Look at Industrial Info Resources
item.description: A biography on Industrial Info Resources and their unique business model. Watch this feature and learn where this up and coming industrial project research company came from. Hear Ed Lewis, CEO and President discuss his business philosophies for building a successful company.

item.title: Your Single Source for High-Density Polyethylene Pipe (HDPE) & Associated Products, by ISCO Industries LLC
item.description: Founded in 1962, ISCO Industries LLC provides the most complete and comprehensive line of HDPE (high density polyethylene) pipe, submersible pumps, valves, pipeline accessories, hoses and fusion equipment that industry has to offer. ISCO Industries proudly maintains the largest inventory of HDPE pipe and associated products in the U.S. Join Shane R. Schuessler, Director of Power Industry Sales of ISCO Industries along with the host of Industry Today and learn about ISCO's HDPE pipe products, sales and rental of joining equipment plus custom fabricated HDPE fittings and structures.
item.itunes:subtitle: Your Single Source for High-Density Polyethylene Pipe (HDPE) & Associated Products, by ISCO Industries LLC
item.itunes:summary: Founded in 1962, ISCO Industries LLC provides the most complete and comprehensive line of HDPE (high density polyethylene) pipe, submersible pumps, valves, pipeline accessories, hoses and fusion equipment that industry has to offer. ISCO Industries proudly maintains the largest inventory of HDPE pipe and associated products in the U.S. Join Shane R. item.title: An Industry Leader at Providing Accurate Mobile Metallurgical Analysis, PMI Specialists
item.description: Founded in 1992, PMI Specialists Incorporated provides on-site alloy verification and accurate test methods for many industries including petrochemical, petroleum refining, power generation, materials distribution, manufacturing & fabrication plus many more. Positive Material Identification (PMI) or alloy analysis, is the analysis of materials by their elemental composition. PMI Specialists serves its clients with only the most dependable on-site alloy verification and accurate testing methods available backed by ISO 9000 certification and a certified laboratory (ILAP). Join Steve Hulsey, President of PMI Specialists along with the host of Industry Today and hear how they can help you reduce metallurgical and liability issues.
item.itunes:subtitle: An Industry Leader at Providing Accurate Mobile Metallurgical Analysis, PMI Specialists
item.itunes:summary: Founded in 1992, PMI Specialists Incorporated provides on-site alloy verification and accurate test methods for many industries including petrochemical, petroleum refining, power generation, materials distribution, manufacturing & fabrication plus many more. item.title: Super Bowl XLVI Stadium Crafted by Building Trades Union Project Labor Agreement
item.description: Projects of all sizes and shapes, both private and public, are utilizing a construction efficiency tool called a Project Labor Agreement, or PLA. The Indianapolis Colts and the city of Indianapolis did exactly that when it came to building Lucas Oil Stadium. As the venue prepares for Super Bowl 46 this weekend, its construction didn't involve any luck at all, but rather ensured on time and on budget results, and in return local workers earned a good wage paid for in part by their tax dollars.
item.itunes:subtitle: Super Bowl XLVI Stadium Crafted by Building Trades Union Project Labor Agreement

item.title: Enabling Productivity Through Innovation, by Trimble
item.description: Trimble is a leading provider of advanced positioning solutions that maximize productivity and enhance profitability. Though best known for GPS technology, Trimble integrates a wide range of positioning technologies including GPS, laser, optical and inertial technologies with application software, wireless communications, and services to provide complete commercial solutions. Its integrated solutions allow customers to collect, manage and analyze complex information faster and easier, making them more productive, efficient and profitable. Join Justin Byrd, Inside Sales Manager of Trimble along with the host of Industry Today to learn how their solutions help field and mobile workers become significantly more productive.

item.title: America's Building Trades Unions Build Educated, Diverse Workforce
item.description: America's Building Trades Unions are made up of millions of skilled, safe, trained and productive men and women. This nationwide network of career construction professionals provides their customers with value that's on display, every day. But, what you may not know is that their diversity efforts are just as evident and now more than ever they're providing opportunities to people of all races and ethnicities to earn a middle-class lifestyle. This video webcast is that story in action.
item.itunes:subtitle: America's Building Trades Unions Build Educated, Diverse Workforce

item.title: Energize your Project with the Power and Flexibility of Partnering, by Audubon Engineering
item.description: Audubon Engineering is a full-service project solutions provider for the domestic and international oil & gas, petrochemical & refining, and power generation markets. Audubon provides the power and flexibility of comprehensive engineering and service disciplines through a unique combination of in-house professionals, affiliate companies, and industry alliance resources. 'Total Flexibility' in providing technical, commercial, and procedural solutions sets Audubon apart from any other provider. Their 'Total Solutions' approach ensures planning, design, and management for a project that will be highly rewarding to you and your stakeholders. Join Brian Maddox, Chief Business Development Office and Managing Partner plus Ragu Nagarajan Business Development Coordinator along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their full-service project solutions.

item.title: Practical Solutions in Vessel Level Indication and Inventory Control, by Monitor Technologies LLC
item.description: Monitor Technologies LLC has been manufacturing level indicating and level measurement instrumentation for the storage of powder and bulk solid materials plus some slurries and liquids for over 50-years. Monitor Technologies has over 15 product lines configurable into thousands of units, implementing technologies ranging from radar to electro-mechanics. Serving markets and applications as broad as plastics, cement, feed & grains, aggregates and more, Monitor Technologies can offer solutions for just about any powder or bulk solid material that is stored in a silo, bin or other vessel. Join Chris Otte Marketing Communications Manager of Monitor Technologies along with the host of Industry Today to hear more about their full line of products and how they continually look for new ways to support your application needs more efficiently.
item.itunes:subtitle: Practical Solutions in Vessel Level Indication and Inventory Control, by Monitor Technologies LLC

item.title: A Full-Service, Nationwide General Contractor, Hoar Construction
item.description: Hoar Construction operates throughout the United States as a distinct leader and provider of construction management, general contracting, program management, preconstruction and design/build services. Hoar Construction has been a general contractor for 70 years and has earned a strong reputation for responsiveness, efficiency, and quality workmanship in every project. Hoar currently employs 640 full-time people nationwide with a commitment to providing value to every client. The firm provides pre-planning services, budget estimates, schedule development, value engineering, cash flow analysis, constructability analysis, and site logistics planning. Join Jay Daily Vice President of Business Development for Hoar Construction along with the host of Industry Today to hear more about the people, technology and industry experience of Hoar Construction.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Full-Service, Nationwide General Contractor, Hoar Construction

item.title: America's Building Trades Unions Benefit Power Producers and Communities
item.description: In this edition of "Industry Today," see how America's Buildings Trades Unions have benefited We Energies by providing on-time and on-budget project construction. The relationships that America's Building Trades Unions develop with their contractors and customers benefit not only clients, but also the communities where the projects are located.

item.title: High Temperature Repair and Inspections While Your Plant is Running, by HRI Incorporated
item.description: HRI Incorporated employs a patented proprietary PPE system that allows high temperature technicians to perform almost any task in extreme heat. HRI's skilled technicians utilize this PPE system with tools, processes and procedures developed by HRI to execute many high temperature tasks including critical path reduction strategies and operational repairs while the unit remains in production. These high temperature tasks include but are not limited to welding and mechanical repairs in industries such as refining, chemicals, power generation, steel and mining operations. Join Roger Rankin President of HRI along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about the systems HRI has developed for the high temperature service industry.
item.itunes:subtitle: High Temperature Repair and Inspections While Your Plant is Running, by HRI Incorporated
item.itunes:summary: HRI Incorporated employs a patented proprietary PPE system that allows high temperature technicians to perform almost any task in extreme heat. HRI's skilled technicians utilize this PPE system with tools, processes and procedures developed by HRI to execute many high temperature tasks including critical path reduction strategies and operational repairs while the unit remains in production. These high temperature tasks include but are not limited to welding and mechanical repairs in industries such as refining, chemicals, power generation, steel and mining operations. Join Roger Rankin President of HRI along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about the systems HRI has developed for the high temperature service industry.

item.title: An International Logistics Operator Specialized in the Infrastructure Sector, by ICI Proyectos
item.description: ICI Proyectos is an international logistics operator specialized in the infrastructure sector in Mexico. ICI Proyectos is a business organization formed by a group of professionals and bilingual staff that has built a powerful network of carriers, warehousing facilities, customs brokers and other specialized service providers with a successful track record in providing professional logistics services for the most important construction projects developed in Mexico over the last decade. Join Miguel Gutierrez Director General of ICI Proyectos along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their mission to remain a leader in providing logistic operation services and international trade consulting to those building and operating the infrastructure of Mexico.
item.itunes:subtitle: An International Logistics Operator Specialized in the Infrastructure Sector, by ICI Proyectos

item.title: Safe Cell Phone, Computers, and Laptops for Work in Rugged, Hazardous Areas
item.description: ecom Instruments GmbH is a certified manufacturer of rugged communications and mobile appliances for use in explosion protected areas. Within their rugged communications product range you will find almost every mobile device for your daily work in the hazardous area, including ruggedized notebook computers, laptops, and cell phones. ecom offers ruggedized notebook laptop computer and cell phones, within the fields of mobile computing, communication, measuring and calibration as well as portable lighting with worldwide certifications, ranging from European ATEX to the American FM-approval. Join a special guest of ecom along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about the products made specifically for harsh environments allowing you to work safely and effectively in extreme, rugged conditions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Safe Cell Phone, Computers, and Laptops for Work in Rugged, Hazardous Areas
item.itunes:summary: ecom Instruments GmbH is a certified manufacturer of rugged communications and mobile appliances for use in explosion protected areas. item.title: Dry Bulk Material Handling Equipment & Systems, by Gerrard & Associates
item.description: Gerrard & Associates is a sales engineering firm representing leading manufacturers of dry bulk material handling systems and equipment since 1973. Through alliance partners and regional A&E firms, Gerrard offers turnkey solutions that include pneumatic conveyors (dilute phase, semi-dense phase, and dense phase), belt conveyors, screw conveyors, bulk bag discharge and filling, tubular drag chain conveyors, and vibrating conveyors. Access to the country's leading manufacturer of drying and cooling solutions, a complete line of level indicators, both point level indicators and continuous level indicators, and a number of dry bulk storage solutions, including tanks and storage silos, enable Gerrard to meet virtually every dry bulk material handling need. Join Bob Gerrard along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about the complete line of products available for immediate delivery.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dry Bulk Material Handling Equipment & Systems, by Gerrard & Associates
item.itunes:summary: Gerrard & Associates is a sales engineering firm representing leading manufacturers of dry bulk material handling systems and equipment since 1973. Access to the country's leading manufacturer of drying and cooling solutions, a complete line of level indicators, both point level indicators and continuous level indicators, and a number of dry bulk storage solutions, including tanks and storage silos, enable Gerrard to meet virtually every dry bulk material handling need. item.title: Smart Solutions to Keep Things Running, by Beumer Group
item.description: Beumer Group is an international leader in the manufacture of intralogistics for conveying, loading, palletizing, packaging, sorting and distribution technology. The experts at Beumer know your product flows, your goods to be moved and their particular characteristics. Beumer Group invests this knowledge in the design and construction of all their plants and systems. In close cooperation with their customers, this ensures that Beumer can always design and realise location relevant solutions. Join Simon Shipp Vice President Conveying and Loading for Beumer Group along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their global presence and ability to meet your most challenging needs.
item.itunes:subtitle: Smart Solutions to Keep Things Running, by Beumer Group

item.title: NECA-IBEW Contractors Rise to Challenges of Wind Turbine-Testing Facility
item.description: While the NECA-IBEW team has special training facilities and programs dedicated to the installation and maintenance of wind turbines, the NECA-IBEW partnership is also contributing to the growth of wind power in other unique ways. To help ensure the optimum and safe functioning of these massive pieces of equipment, wind turbine blades are tested at facilities such as the Wind Technology Testing Center (WTTC) at the Massachusetts Clean Energy Center. All of the facility's wiring and electrical work was installed by NECA-IBEW contractors, specifically NECA contractor Dagle Electrical Construction Corporation, a member of IBEW Local 103.
item.itunes:subtitle: NECA-IBEW Contractors Rise to Challenges of Wind Turbine-Testing Facility
item.itunes:summary: While the NECA-IBEW team has special training facilities and programs dedicated to the installation and maintenance of wind turbines, the NECA-IBEW partnership is also contributing to the growth of wind power in other unique ways. item.title: Validation and CGMP Consulting Services, by ValSource LLC
item.description: ValSource is a leading provider of validation and CGMP consulting services to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. ValSource can provide a full range of validation and CGMP related services from protocol preparation and field execution to project management, training and cost control. These services include validation project management, validation master plan preparation, CGMP training and audit preparedness training, commissioning and startup plus much more. Join Hal Baseman of ValSource to learn more about their ability to provide experienced engineers, managers and technicians for your most critical validation project.

item.title: Superior Industrial Maintenance, Turnaround and Construction Services, by CEDA International Corporation
item.description: CEDA International Corporation is a global leader driven by talented and passionate people who are committed 24/7 to delivering world class industrial maintenance, turnaround and construction services through innovative technologies, equipment and processes, safely every time. Since 1973, clients have relied on CEDA International Corporation to deliver outstanding technical services that optimize their investments, improve their competitive position and increase their long-term success. Join Bruce Rintoul Chief Executive Officer of CEDA along with the host of Industry Today to hear more about why CEDA is considered one of the most diverse providers of industrial and specialty services in the world.

item.title: Industrial Insulation and related Specialty Contracting Services, by Iberville Companies LLC
item.description: Iberville Companies LLC provides a variety of industrial insulation and specialty contracting services to the power, refining and chemical industries. These premium services are provided through one of three subsidiaries Iberville Insulations LLC, Industrial Asbestos Removal LLC and Bienville Industries LLC, each providing specialized contracting services to best meet the various market demands. Join Ben Felterman of Iberville Companies along with the host of Industry Today and learn how their focus on safety, quality and performance has successfully met and exceeded the expectations of many clients throughout the U.S. for the past thirty years
item.itunes:subtitle: Industrial Insulation and related Specialty Contracting Services, by Iberville Companies LLC
item.itunes:summary: Iberville Companies LLC provides a variety of industrial insulation and specialty contracting services to the power, refining and chemical industries. These premium services are provided through one of three subsidiaries Iberville Insulations LLC, Industrial Asbestos Removal LLC and Bienville Industries LLC, each providing specialized contracting services to best meet the various market demands. Join Ben Felterman of Iberville Companies along with the host of Industry Today and learn how their focus on safety, quality and performance has successfully met and exceeded the expectations of many clients throughout the U.S. for the past thirty years

item.title: NECA-IBEW Contractors Use Thermography to Increase Efficiency, Mitigate Risks
item.description: Thermography is a technology that allows contractors to identify potential issues with equipment and electrical components before serious problems occur. This episode of "Industry Today" explores how NECA-IBEW contractors use thermography to help increase efficiencies in buildings and equipment, as well as mitigate risks.

item.title: A Leading Provider of Rotating and Reciprocating Machinery Services, by Universal Plant Services
item.description: Universal Plant Services (UPS) is a leading provider of rotating and reciprocating machinery services to the refining, petrochemical and power generation industries. Founded in 1986, UPS provides expert repair and service of turbines, pumps and compressors and premier field machining services, delivering exceptional value through superior results. Delivering more than 1.3 million manhours of service annually, UPS customers' can expect to get a firm commitment to safety, quality, the in-depth knowledge of expert craftsmen, and innovative solutions to their repair or maintenance needs. Join a special guest of Universal Plant Services along with the host of Industry Today to hear more about how they can care for your business critical turbines, pumps, compressors and components.

item.title: Innovative Control System Integration and Monitoring Solutions, by Governor Control Systems, Inc
item.description: Governor Control Systems (GCS) is a customer needs driven company committed to providing advanced control solutions and value added services for the power generation, industrial and marine markets. Their 24/7 service, technical support, training, and engineering services ensure that GCS is your partner for the lifecycle of your control, monitoring and measuring systems. From standard products to custom software, GCS design engineers specialize in control, monitoring and protection system modernizations and programming solutions. GCS engineers support your project from initial site visit to installation and commissioning, as well as training your operators and engineers on the new system. Join Kenny Dennis of Governor Control Systems along with the host of Industry Today to learn how they develop and maintain customer relationships through timely, flexible response and diligent execution.

item.title: Wire & Cable Solutions for the Energy, Utility, Infrastructure and Industrial Markets, by Houston Wire & Cable Company
item.description: Specializing in energy, utility, infrastructure and industrial markets since 1975, Houston Wire & Cable Company (HWC) brings experience and a track record of success to projects both domestic and abroad. HWC maintains an inventory of nearly $100 million encompassing approximately 30,000 products from the industry leading manufacturers of electrical and mechanical wire and cable. With strategically located sales and distribution centers throughout the U.S., their team is focused on providing a single-source solution that is committed to providing each customer the most value by offering high levels of industry experience, superior customer service, and a large selection of quality in-stock items. Join guests Adrian Graham & Ted Sidenstricker of HWC along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their broad wire and cable product offerings that meet the industry's most demanding needs.

item.title: Superior Analyzer Sample Conditioning Components, by A+ Corporation
item.description: A+ Corporation develops manufactures, and markets analyzer sample conditioning components and moisture/corrosion control products. Founded in 1989, A+ is a leader in providing analytically correct analyzer sample conditioning solutions to the natural gas, petrochemical and petroleum refining industries globally. Analyzer sample conditioning components by A+ Corporation are expertly designed to protect and preserve sample integrity. Join Keith Mayeaux President of A+ Corporation, along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their superior products.

item.title: Structural Steel Fabricators offering Quality and Reliability, by Myrex Industries
item.description: For over two decades, Myrex Industries has been providing structural and miscellaneous steel fabrication for commercial, industrial, and oil and gas applications. Myrex has over 158,000 square feet of fabrication space and more than fifteen acres of outside storage. Located ten miles from the Port of Houston, Myrex can expedite deliveries worldwide. With production capabilities ranging from multi-story buildings to pipe supports and handrails, no job is too large or too small for Myrex Industries. Whether your project requires fabrication, painting or galvanizing, or structural erection, Myrex can provide these products and services - and more! Join Pravin Patel of Myrex along with the host of Industry Today and discover how Myrex can provide a cost effective solution for your next project.

item.title: Innovative and Quality Signs for the Utility Industry, by Vulcan Utility Signs Inc.
item.description: Vulcan Utility Signs Inc., a division of Vulcan, Inc has provided the utility industry with a full range of quality products for over 30 years. Vulcan Utility produces a variety of marking products for various segments of the utility industry including pipelines, communications, electrical power and water/wastewater. Vulcan proudly manufactures custom-designed utility marking products that exceed the customer's expectations for quality and endurance. Vulcan Utility Signs is continually developing new ways to help its clients stay ahead in the field. Join Bob Hamlin of Vulcan Utility Signs along with the host of Industry Today to find out how their innovative team can create custom utility products that will help your business operate more safely and efficiently.

item.title: Optimized Design and Engineering for Stacks and Duct Systems, by Industrial Environmental Systems, Inc.
item.description: Industrial Environmental Systems (IES) provides air pollution control, heat transfer and noise abatement solutions specializing in precision engineered ductwork, stacks, dampers, expansion joint and support systems. IES systems are engineered to optimize performance by assuring that structural and performance standards are met or exceeded with the most cost effective choice of design and materials. Join Chuck Reid Vice President of Industrial Environmental Systems along with the host of Industry Today to learn about their advanced computer design techniques that provide optimum solutions to complex projects.

item.title: Full Service Rotating Equipment Repair Shop and More, by Powerhouse Mechanical
item.description: Powerhouse Mechanical Repair, Inc. is an experienced group of engineers, steam turbine and valve specialists, rotating equipment repair technicians, machinists and fabricators. The experts of Powerhouse Mechanical can provide these services in their 21,000 sqft facility or at your plant site including around-the-clock emergency rush service when necessary to get your facility up and running better than ever. From one-off prototype parts to larger production runs, babbitted bearing repair to full steam turbine overhaul, Powerhouse Mechanical is staffed and equipped to meet and exceed your expectations. Join John Andrews President of Powerhouse Mechanical along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about this company and their record of superior mechanical repair.

item.title: AEP Teams with NECA-IBEW to Instill Code of Excellence on $1 Billion FGD Scrubber Project at West Virginia Power Plant
item.description: Earlier this year, American Electric Power (NYSE:AEP) (Columbus, Ohio), and its contractors completed work on a $1 billion Flue Gas Desulfurization (FGD) Scrubber project at the company's 35-year-old, 2,900-megawatt John Amos power plant in Winfield, West Virginia. The project involved the retrofit of three coal-fired power generation units with FGD scrubbers to reduce emissions, and was implemented using the IBEW's code of excellence. The Code of Excellence program instituted by the IBEW and endorsed by its NECA contractors creates a common set of expectations between project owners, contractors and labor, setting expectations for safety, productivity, implementation, cost and respect for the environment. The NECA-IBEW Code of Excellence program was instrumental in the success of the project. As interviewed on ElectricTV, Thomas P. Householder, the director of administrative services for AEP, stated, "About 20% of the work on the project involved IBEW hours, so the IBEW labor was crucial to the success of the project."
item.itunes:subtitle: AEP Teams with NECA-IBEW to Instill Code of Excellence on $1 Billion FGD Scrubber Project at West Virginia Power Plant
item.itunes:summary: Earlier this year, American Electric Power (NYSE:AEP) (Columbus, Ohio), and its contractors completed work on a $1 billion Flue Gas Desulfurization (FGD) Scrubber project at the company's 35-year-old, 2,900-megawatt John Amos power plant in Winfield, West Virginia. The project involved the retrofit of three coal-fired power generation units with FGD scrubbers to reduce emissions, and was implemented using the IBEW's code of excellence. The Code of Excellence program instituted by the IBEW and endorsed by its NECA contractors creates a common set of expectations between project owners, contractors and labor, setting expectations for safety, productivity, implementation, cost and respect for the environment. The NECA-IBEW Code of Excellence program was instrumental in the success of the project. As interviewed on ElectricTV, Thomas P. Householder, the director of administrative services for AEP, stated, "About 20% of the work on the project involved IBEW hours, so the IBEW labor was crucial to the success of the project."

item.title: Better Emissions for a Better Bottom Line, by Honeywell
item.description: When power customers want to reduce their NOx emissions, they call Honeywell. Honeywell SCR units are designed to provide maximum NOx reduction and minimum environmental impact for gas powered turbines in peaking and combined cycle applications. Honeywell's turnkey solutions and industry leading design let the customer concentrate on the bottom line and worry less about emissions limits. Honeywell's patent pending high performance mixing technology results in increased catalyst efficiency, increased catalyst life and reduction of ammonia consumption and slip. Join Chris Ferguson, SCR Applications Engineer, along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about Honeywell SCR technology.

item.title: Fuel Cells Providing Green Options for Combined Heat and Power Applications
item.description: The desire for green energy solutions to reduce greenhouse gas emissions is driving the development of fuel cell technology. Recently a number of small scale fuel cell power plants have come online including those constructed by FuelCell Energy (Nasdaq:FCEL) (Danbury, Connecticut). Fuel cell technology is purported to produce electricity that is 300% more efficient than traditional fossil fuels. Join Dominic Giarratano spokesman for NECA-IBEW and Chris Pais, Manager Application Engineering for FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) (Danbury, Connecticut) as they tour a San Francisco area wastewater treatment plant biogas fuel cell project in operation.

item.title: A World Leader in Air and Liquid Filtration Solutions, by Menardi
item.description: Established in 1913, Menardi has become a world leader in providing both air and liquid filtration solutions to industry. From innovative products designed for improved filtration performance, to unmatched research and development capabilities, to their position as a global leader offering an extensive range of application experience, Menardi is continually working to develop new and improved filtration products. For air filtration Menardi manufactures and supplies all styles of filter bags for use in pulse-jet, reverse air, and shaker baghouses. For liquid filtration Menardi offers a full line of woven fabrics and felt media for liquid/solid separation. Join Bill Zimmerman, Senior Vice President Sales & Marketing of Menardi along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their products and focus on quality products through research and development and customer service.

item.title: Material Handling Solutions, by Jeffrey Rader Corporation
item.description: Jeffrey Rader Corporation is a leading U.S. manufacturer of chip sizer mills, hammermills and other size reduction equipment for use by companies in the paper and pulp industries and for similar applications in other industries, including solid waste reduction. Jeffrey Rader designs and manufactures material handling equipment and systems to mechanically unload, convey, lift and handle materials for the Pulp & Paper, Forest Products, Energy Generation, Petrochemical, Resource Recovery, Cement, and Recycling industries. Join Ted Gentile Sales & Marketing Manager of Jeffrey Rader Corporation along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their newest products and continuing technology advancements.

item.title: Project Labor Agreements Work for California Power Plant Construction and More
item.description: Project Labor Agreements or PLAs receive their fair amount of attention from those who argue for their elimination and those who defend their presence in the construction industry. In the last 15 years, California's Building Trades Unions, through their superior training programs and productivity, have built 96% of the Power Plants in the state for satisfied customers. But, watch and listen to what happened when they weren't hired to do the work and it will be clear which workforce makes better business sense.

item.title: Global Security Solutions, by G4S Americas
item.description: G4S Americas is a leading provider of security solutions employing more than 50,000 people across the United States and Canada plus operations in more than 125 countries around the world. Whether you require a security solution in one location or across multiple continents, the global experience of G4S offers a unique combination of personnel, project management, risk management, and technology solutions. G4S focuses on advancing the safety and security of businesses and governments, ensuring the security of key assets--people, property, products and reputation. Join Carlos Barbosa Senior Director of G4S along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about how they work to safeguard the welfare and prosperity of millions of people worldwide.

item.title: Essential Services for Protecting and Optimizing the Operation of Rotating Equipment, by RoMaDyn
item.description: RoMaDyn (Rotating Machinery Reliability Services) offers the essential services needed to protect and optimize the operation of rotating machinery assets including machinery diagnostics, technical training, product services and custom tailored turnkey services. These solutions are offered across the United States and to certain international markets by a highly qualified and experienced team of field engineers and industry specialists equipped with the tools and knowledge to deliver maximum results. Join Tracy Walkup, RoMaDyn Regional Sales Manager along with the host of Industry Today to learn more about their industry experience and ability to provide cost effective solutions with immediate results.

item.title: NECA-IBEW Team to Manufacture and Deploy Electric Car Charging Stations
item.description: At an estimated two cents per mile versus 40 cents per mile for gasoline-powered vehicles, electric cars may be the vehicle of the future. But a tremendous amount of infrastructure in the form of charging stations will need to be constructed for electric cars to be viable. Automotive manufacturers are ramping up production of electric cars. The Chevy Volt and the Nissan Leaf are two of many electric cars on the market. By 2015, the U.S. Government has called for 1 million electric cars to be on the road. Join Mike Dinucci, Vice President Strategic Accounts for Columb Technologies in this ElectricTV webcast as he talks about the newest technology regarding Electric Car charging stations.
item.itunes:subtitle: NECA-IBEW Team to Manufacture and Deploy Electric Car Charging Stations

item.title: A World Leader in Acoustical Consulting and Noise Abatement Technology, by ATCO Noise Management
item.description: ATCO Noise Management, an ATCO Group company, is a full service E+P+C/M contractor with decades of experience in the design and construction of noise control solutions. ATCO Noise Management employs the expertise to design and construct everything from barrier walls to equipment enclosures and even entire structures to enhance worker productivity and community relations by reducing noise levels. ATCO serves all large industry with a focus on power generation, natural gas development, environmental remediation and industrial manufacturing industries. Serving every need from initial assessment, design and installation of the noise abatement or post construction noise level testing, ATCO can provide a solution. Join Michael Hillery District Manager of ATCO Noise Management along with the host of Industry Today to hear more about their Balanced Design ApproachTM and team of industry experts ready to meet your most demanding acoustical needs.

channel.media:description: Exclusively from Industrialinfo.com, Industry Today podcasts feature the latest in industrial market news, companies within industry, market trends, business, economic and finance.
